material.mattext: How can you create a gradient fill for a shape in Figma?
Use the "Gradient Fill" tool from the toolbar.
Select the shape, go to the right sidebar, and add a gradient fill in the "Fill" section.
Right-click the shape and choose "Add Gradient Fill."
Use the "Gradient Fill" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Slice" feature in Figma?
To cut a design file into multiple sections for easier navigation.
To remove unwanted portions of the design.
To export specific sections of the design as individual image assets.
To share a specific section of the design with others.
How can you group layers together in Figma?
Select the layers, right-click, and choose "Group."
Use the "Group Layers" option in the Edit menu.
Drag and drop the layers onto each other.
Use the "Group" tool from the toolbar.
What is the purpose of the "Redline" feature in Figma?
To mark design elements for removal or modification.
To highlight specific sections of the design for emphasis.
To add comments and annotations for developers or stakeholders.
To collaborate with team members on design reviews.
How can you adjust the opacity of a layer in Figma?
Use the "Opacity" tool from the toolbar.
Select the layer and adjust the opacity value in the right sidebar.
Right-click the layer and choose "Adjust Opacity."
Use the "Opacity" option in the Edit menu.
How can you create a scrollable area in Figma?
Use the "Scrollable Area" tool from the toolbar.
Apply a mask to a group of layers.
Use the "Overflow" property in the right sidebar and set it to "Scroll" or "Auto."
Use the "Create Scrollable Area" option in the Edit menu.
How can you rotate a layer in Figma?
Use the "Rotate" tool from the toolbar.
Select the layer and adjust the rotation angle in the right sidebar.
Right-click the layer and choose "Rotate."
Use the "Rotate" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Export" feature in Figma?
To save the design file in a different format.
To export design assets for development or use in other applications.
To generate design specifications and style guides.
To share the design with clients and stakeholders.
How can you duplicate a layer in Figma?
Right-click the layer and choose "Duplicate."
Select the layer and press Command + D (Mac. or Control + D (Windows).
Use the "Duplicate Layer" option in the Edit menu.
Drag and drop the layer while holding the Option (Mac. or Alt (Windows) key.
How can you zoom in and out of the canvas in Figma?
Use the zoom slider in the toolbar.
Press Command + Plus (Mac. or Control + Plus (Windows) to zoom in and Command + Minus (Mac. or Control + Minus (Windows) to zoom out.
Right-click the canvas and choose "Zoom In" or "Zoom Out."
Use the "Zoom" option in the View menu.
How can you group multiple layers together in Figma?
Right-click and select "Group."
Select the layers, then press Command + G (Mac. or Control + G (Windows).
Drag and drop the layers onto each other.
Use the "Group" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Slice" tool in Figma?
To crop and resize images in the design.
To export specific sections of the design for web or development.
To create custom shapes and icons.
To apply advanced masking effects to design elements.
How can you adjust the opacity of a layer in Figma?
Use the "Opacity" slider in the Layers panel.
Select the layer and adjust the opacity value in the right sidebar.
Right-click the layer and choose "Adjust Opacity."
Use the "Opacity" option in the Edit menu.
How can you align multiple layers horizontally in Figma?
Use the Align panel and select the desired alignment option.
Right-click the layers and choose "Align Horizontally."
Select the layers, then press Shift + H.
Use the "Align Horizontally" option in the Edit menu.
How can you change the background color of the canvas in Figma?
Right-click the canvas and select "Change Background Color."
Use the "Canvas Settings" option in the View menu.
Select the canvas, then adjust the "Background" color in the right sidebar.
Use the "Background Color" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the frame tool in Figma?
To add text to the design.
To define a container for other design elements.
To apply effects and filters to the design.
To import images into the design.
Which option is used to select multiple layers at once in Figma?
Shift + Click
Command + Click
Option + Click
Control + Click
How can you create a copy of a design element in Figma?
Right-click and select "Duplicate."
Press Command + D (Mac. or Control + D (Windows).
Drag and drop while holding the Option key (Mac. or Alt key (Windows).
Use the Copy/Paste commands in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Auto Layout" feature in Figma?
To automatically apply pre-designed layouts to the design.
To generate responsive designs for different screen sizes.
To create dynamic and flexible designs that adapt to content changes.
To align elements with precision on the canvas.
How can you undo your last action in Figma?
Edit > Undo
Right-click and select "Undo."
Cmd + Z (Mac. or Ctrl + Z (Windows)
View > Undo History
How can you align multiple layers vertically in Figma?
Use the Align panel and select the desired alignment option.
Right-click the layers and choose "Align Vertically."
Select the layers, then press Shift + V.
Use the "Align Vertically" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Boolean Operations" feature in Figma?
To create complex animations.
To generate random patterns.
To combine and manipulate shapes to create custom designs.
To apply mathematical functions to design elements.
How can you add a hyperlink to a design element in Figma?
Use the "Hyperlink" tool from the toolbar.
Select the element, go to the right sidebar, and add the hyperlink in the "Prototype" tab.
Right-click the element and choose "Add Hyperlink."
Use the "Insert Hyperlink" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Boolean Operations" feature in Figma?
To create complex animations.
To generate random patterns.
To combine and manipulate shapes to create custom designs.
To apply mathematical functions to design elements.
How can you lock a layer in Figma?
Right-click the layer and choose "Lock."
Select the layer, go to the right sidebar, and toggle the lock icon.
Use the "Lock" option in the Edit menu.
Press Command + L (Mac. or Control + L (Windows).
What is the purpose of the "Components" panel in Figma?
To access pre-designed UI kits and templates.
To manage and organize design assets in the project.
To create reusable design elements that can be easily updated across the project.
To generate code snippets for developers.
How can you create a text style in Figma?
Right-click a text layer and select "Create Text Style."
Use the "Text Style" option in the Edit menu.
Select a text layer, then click the "+" button next to the "Text Styles" section in the right sidebar.
Use the "Create Style" command in the Layers panel.
What is the purpose of the "Prototype" mode in Figma?
To switch between design and prototype views.
To create interactive and clickable prototypes for user testing and feedback.
To collaborate with team members on the design project.
To present the design to stakeholders in a slideshow format.
How can you adjust the letter spacing (tracking) of a text layer in Figma?
Use the "Letter Spacing" slider in the Text panel.
Select the text layer and adjust the "Letter Spacing" value in the right sidebar.
Right-click the text layer and choose "Adjust Letter Spacing."
Use the "Tracking" option in the Edit menu.
How can you apply a drop shadow effect to a layer in Figma?
Use the "Drop Shadow" tool from the toolbar.
Select the layer and adjust the "Drop Shadow" settings in the right sidebar.
Right-click the layer and choose "Apply Drop Shadow."
Use the "Add Effects" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Constraints" feature in Figma?
To apply visual effects to design elements.
To control the stacking order of layers.
To group and organize design elements.
To define how a layer behaves when its parent container is resized.
Which option allows you to apply a gradient fill to a shape in Figma?
The Paint Bucket tool
The Stroke panel
The Fill panel
The Layer Styles panel
How can you create a component in Figma?
Select the design element(s), right-click, and choose "Create Component."
Press Command + G (Mac. or Control + G (Windows).
Drag and drop the design element(s) into the Components panel.
Use the "Convert to Component" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Vector Networks" feature in Figma?
To create realistic 3D shapes in the design.
To apply complex transformations to design elements.
To draw and edit vector paths with more flexibility and precision.
To import and export vector graphics from other applications.
How can you add a border to a shape in Figma?
Right-click the shape and select "Add Border."
Use the Stroke panel and adjust the stroke settings.
Select the shape and click the "+" button next to the "Fills" section in the right sidebar.
Use the "Borders" option in the Edit menu.
How can you create a color style in Figma?
Select a shape or text layer with the desired color, go to the right sidebar, and click the "+" button next to the "Colors" section.
Right-click the layer and choose "Create Color Style."
Use the "Color Styles" option in the Edit menu.
Press Command + Option + C (Mac. or Control + Alt + C (Windows).
What is the purpose of the "Team Libraries" feature in Figma?
To manage design assets locally on a team's computers.
To create a centralized library of design components and styles for the team to share.
To export design assets for use in other applications.
To collaborate with team members on design projects.
How can you create a dashed border for a shape in Figma?
Right-click the shape and choose "Add Dashed Border."
Use the Stroke panel and adjust the stroke settings.
Select the shape, go to the right sidebar, and toggle the dashed border option.
Use the "Dashed Border" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Version History" feature in Figma?
To revert to a previous version of the design.
To view and restore previous versions of the design.
To track and manage design iterations and changes.
To collaborate with team members on design revisions.
How can you import images into Figma?
Right-click the canvas and choose "Import Image."
Use the "Import" option in the File menu.
Drag and drop images onto the canvas or the Layers panel.
Use the "Insert Image" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Library" feature in Figma?
To manage and organize design files within a project.
To create a centralized repository of design components and styles for reuse across multiple projects.
To collaborate with team members on specific design files.
To publish the design to a public library for others to access.
How can you create a custom shape in Figma?
Use the "Custom Shape" tool from the toolbar.
Combine basic shapes using boolean operations like union, subtract, intersect, or exclude.
Right-click the canvas and choose "Create Custom Shape."
Use the "Custom Shape" option in the Edit menu.
What is the purpose of the "Team Library" in Figma?
To store design files accessible to the entire team.
To create a shared library of design assets that can be used by team members.
To collaborate with team members on specific design files.
To manage user permissions within a design project.
How can you adjust the line height of a text layer in Figma?
Use the "Line Height" slider in the Text panel.
Select the text layer and adjust the "Line Height" value in the right sidebar.
Right-click the text layer and choose "Adjust Line Height."
Use the "Line Height" option in the Edit menu.
How can you create a nested component in Figma?
Select the layers you want to include in the component, right-click, and choose "Create Component."
Use the "Nested Component" option in the Edit menu.
Drag and drop the layers onto an existing component while holding the Option (Mac. or Alt (Windows) key.
Use the "Create Nested Component" tool from the toolbar.
